results.name: default/mysql-5c8cc764c9-cxrfs
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/wordpress-7d89bf79cb-lft42
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-5c8cc764c9-cxrfs], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the specified pod is not ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs Pod/mysql-5c8cc764c9-cxrfs`. 3. Ensure the pod is running and healthy. 4. Verify readiness probes in pod configuration.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-7d89bf79cb-lft42], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is not ready because the expected pod is not running or available.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. If not running, inspect with `kubectl describe pod <pod-name>`.
3. Review logs using `kubectl logs <pod-name>`.
4. Resolve any issues and restart the pod.
